newsitem.title: USA: MGE spring wheat ends higher as March shorts cover.
newsitem.headline: MGE spring wheat ends higher as March shorts cover.

text.p: MGE spring wheat futures closed higher, supported by heavy short covering in the March contract ahead of Friday's first notice day.
"There were 11 million (bushels) left open (as of Wednesday night) and we probably saw half of that liquidated today," one floor trader said.
MGE March open interest, as of February 26, totalled 11.43 million bushels. No wheat was expected to be posted for delivery when notices are issued Friday.
Dealers said featured buyers of the March/May spread included Wilson Trading and Atwood Commodities.
Country Hedging and LFG were among the sellers of the spread, traders said.
March closed 5-1/4 cents a bushel higher at $4.05-3/4. Other months were 4-3/4 to four cents higher.
